I asked multiple police officers if the audio is realtime. They explained there is a ~45 second delay between live transmissions and the app, then demonstrated this in front of me. It's to prevent criminals from using it for crime; I could also see it simply being a software based side effect. Whatever the case if you require realtime police monitoring just buy a hardware scanner. You can't honestly expect a free android app to perform as well as a dedicated scanner. It's become a new hobby to listen in on all the chaos happening in the area, especially late at night and/or the weekends. Yes, we all know there are and always will be thugs and evil-doers but just about every time I turn this thing on in the evening I'm reminded why I'll always value animals over humans. Sure can be a circus out there, especially in recent months of the lockdown and loss of jobs, the crime has shot up ~87%, people are bored, and less-than-reputable people choose crime in lieu of bettering themselves via learning a new hobby or fixing up the flop house they call home. But hey, that'd make too much sense. Speaking of not making any sense, what's with the ad whoring? We used to have static promos which do well enough to keep volunteer programs and other functions afloat. Is there any reason why loud-ass videos need to interrupt the broadcasts now? Spreading those cheeks kind of wide while bent over, aren't we? A way around this is to turn on the station and immediately turn the screen off. Good-bye to all the excessively loud videos about feminine things, bladder problems, anal seepage, and other irrelevant/embarrassing content!
